message_1: Using the Playfair cipher, encode the message "MEET ME AT TWELVE" with the key "MATH" and provide the encoded message.
message_2:
First, we need to create a 5x5 Playfair cipher table using the key "MATH". Remove duplicate letters from the key and fill the remaining spaces with the rest of the alphabet (omitting J since I and J are considered the same in the Playfair cipher).

M A T H
B C D E
F G I K
L N O P
Q R S U
V W X Y
Z

Now, we can encode the message "MEET ME AT TWELVE". We will remove spaces and break the message into digraphs. If a digraph has the same letter twice, we will insert an X between them.

ME ET ME AT TW EL VE

Now, we will encode each digraph using the Playfair cipher table:

ME -> OD
ET -> ZC
ME -> OD
AT -> MA
TW -> FN
EL -> CH
VE -> YK

The encoded message is "ODZCODMAFNCHYK".
